alert.note: Alert for Polk (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 7:16AM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Euharlee Creek at US 278 at Rockmart affecting Polk County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Euharlee Creek at US 278 at Rockmart. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9 feet, Minor flooding begins along the creek upstream and downstream from the gage on Church Street. Portions of the Wayside Park will have water a foot or two deep. Sections of the sidewalk along Water Street will begin to flood. The water reaches the bottom of The Silver Comet Trail foot bridge just downstream from West Elm Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 9 feet and rising. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 9 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
